div.span: Remote learning will continue until school is recessed for the summer. Date to follow.

img.style: width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

br.span: Please click on the attached flyer for more information about the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and help stop the spread of rumors.

div.a: Annual Town and School District Voting

span.div: The Second Session of the annual meeting of the Town of Litchfield and Litchfield School District will be held at Campbell High School on Tuesday, March 10, 2020, from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm for the choice of Town and School District Officers elected by official ballot, to vote on questions required by law to be inserted on the official ballot, and to vote on all Warrant Articles from the first session on official ballot per RSA 40:13, VII.
A Voter Guide and Sample Ballot are attached for your convenience.
The Litchfield School District has adopted the ALICe response protocol for emergencies in our schools. For more information, please click on the link provided.
For further information or questions, please contact the SAU Office at 603-578-3570 x3330.

div.a: School Board Public Statement: Staff Tuition

br.span: Student Handbooks for GMS, LMS and CHS are now being published online.
Comcast has a new program to provide low-cost broadband internet access to eligible families in the National School Lunch Program.

a.title: The Litchfield School Board is scheduled to meet on Wednesday, May 6, 2020 at 6:00 pm at Litchfield Town Hall.  The public is welcome to attend.
Location: CHS Learning Commons Starting at: 6:30 PM
Location: CHS Learning Commons Starting at: 7:00 AM Ending at: 7:30 AM
The Litchfield School Board is scheduled to meet on Wednesday, May 20, 2020 at 6:00 pm at Litchfield Town Hall.  The public is welcome to attend.
The Litchfield School Board is scheduled to meet on Wednesday, June 3, 2020 at 6:00 pm at Litchfield Town Hall.  The public is welcome to attend.
Location: CHS Learning Commons Starting at: 6:30 PM

div.span: Due to abundant caution, the Litchfield School District is suspending all sheduled activities and events, both before and after school at Griffin Memorial School, Litchfield Middle School and Campbell High School, for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

span.span: This webpage is dedicated to providing our school community with the latest information on COVID-19. This information is subject to change without notice as we receive additional information. We suggest you continue to check back periodically for the most accurate information.
Below we will archive all information and press releases sent to parents. We will continueto add links to important resources as needed.

span.span: CDC Guidance on school environmental cleaning and disinfecting

div.span: If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the SAU Office at 603-578-3570.

LITCHFIELD SCHOOL DISTRICT
COVID-19 UPDATE
April 19, 2020 School Closure Update
normal;background:white'>Hope this note finds everyone doing well! I want to give a quick update to a few points in my Thursday update last week:normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>Room Cleanout- To help prepare classrooms for summer cleaning, we have developeda plan forEnd of Year Classroom Cleanout. It includes an opportunity for parents to retrieve any items left in the classrooms. We will be following good hygiene, social distancing, and allowing collected items an opportunity to "rest"before being made available to families. Watch school newsletters for details on how to pick up materials in the coming weeks.normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>Last day- We are still working on an end of the year date. I believe we will be able to have most students finish up earlier than normal, but have to confirm plans with our two employee associations.Please be patient as we work out the details.normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>Finances- As a district, we have committed to keeping our staff employed by working remotely. Since many of our employees live in Litchfield, this is important to ourlocal economy in thistime of financial stress for somany families.Remember that about 85% of our annual budget is personnel costs! While we are committed to providing all of the contracted terms to our dedicated employees, we are also looking for cost savings in utilities, supplies, transportation, etc. Our goal is to provide a largeenough fund balance this June to completely off-set projected tax rate increases next fall. With so many families out of work and struggling with bills, we must do our part as the largest consumer of tax dollars in Litchfield to help soften the economic impact of COVID-19. When Litchfieldtaxpayers approved our school budget on March 10th, they really had no idea what was lurking around the corner. The taxpayers have supported us by approving contracts and school budgets - now we need to position the district to support taxpayers by cautiously, strategically, and wisely spending their dollars during remote learning.normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>Direct Instruction- Based on last week's survey, about 22% of students and 30% of parents think we are not delivering enough direct instruction. While 30% of our staff reported delivering 10+ hours of direct instruction in a week, 24% reported delivering 1-3 hours. We have asked our staff toconsider finding ways to ensurestudents have multiple opportunities for direct contact each week, including ample time for direct instruction. We all know that education is largely about building relationships with our students. Wewill always remember the "COVID-19 shutdown semester", and students will remember the way our staff helped to support them!normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>We'll have additional survey questions next week. Remember, we are working 3 days of April break (4/28 - 30) and taking two long weekends (to include 4/27 and 5/1 as vacation days).normal;background:white'>normal;background:white'>Stay Strong & Be well!normal;background:white'>Mike
